intro: Hieracium bigeminum, commonly known as the twin-flowered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, with two flowers per stem, giving it its common name. Hieracium bigeminum is a perennial herb that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
